context.inputs:
Rank the following resumes for the most qualified candidate for a software engineer role:

MAHESH BHARTI

[Professional Experience]

**Senior Software Engineer, Google**
Mountain View, CA — 2015-Present

- Oversaw the deployment, configuration and documentation processes for multiple projects.
- Coordinated with cross-functional teams to draft project schedules and plans.
- Promoted code quality through leading by example, conducting code reviews and intensive testing.
- Mentored junior software engineers, improving debugging practices and efficacy.

**Software Developer, Microsoft**
Redmond, WA — 2010-2015

- Handled full lifecycle development projects, bolstering software sustainability.
- Identified and located code problems, planning rewrites for enhanced performance.
- Utilized SQL programming language to optimize and automate processes.
- Held weekly training sessions for new interns and employees.

[Education]

**Bachelor of Science in Computer Science**
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)

[Skills]

- Profound knowledge of Java, C++, PHP, Python.
- Excellent knowledge of MySQL, HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
- Strong grasp on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
- Exceptional problem-solving, communication and team collaboration skills.
- Proficient in Agile and Scrum methodologies.
<hr>
AKSHAY TRIVEDI

**WORK EXPERIENCE**

**Senior Software Engineer, Google, Mountain View, CA — June 2015-Present**

• Coordinated with a team of software professionals to develop scalable applications using Java and Python.
• Pioneered a data protection system, enhancing security by 45%.
• Conducted in-depth code reviews to enhance software quality and functionality.
• Supplied thorough end-user training and technical documentation.

**Software Engineer, IBM, San Francisco, CA - Jan 2010 - June 2015**

• Designed, implemented, and maintained software applications in C++ and Java.
• Identified and corrected software bugs, improving functionality by 30%.
• Contributed to cloud computing solution development and implementation.
• Mentored junior team members, ensuring efficient workflow and productivity.

**EDUCATION**

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
Stanford University, Stanford, CA

**SKILLS**

• Java, Python, and C++
• Full Stack Development
• Bug Tracking
• Agile/Scrum Methodology
• Data Protection
• Cloud Computing<hr>
context.systems_message:
You are an HR assistance bot. You help hiring managers find the right candidate. Respond succintly with only names. Evaluate resumes separated by <hr>. Evaluate candidates against the following job description: Our software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to the firm's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage the firms cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to our Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities
Write and test product or system development code.
Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.
